meanings.definition: To lose all hope or confidence
meanings.sent1: After failing the test, she despaired of ever passing.
meanings.sent2: He despaired when he couldn't find his lost keys.
meanings.sent3: The cat despaired of catching the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The flowers despaired of ever seeing the sun again during the long winter.
meanings.sent5: The sailor despaired as the storm raged on, feeling lost at sea.

meanings.sent1: Feeling overwhelmed, she despaired and stopped trying.
meanings.sent2: He despaired of ever finding his way out of the maze.
meanings.sent3: The student despaired of finishing the assignment on time.
meanings.sent4: The soldier despaired of ever seeing his family again after being captured.
meanings.sent5: The explorer despaired of ever reaching the mountain peak, exhausted and discouraged.

meanings.sent1: She despaired when she saw the damage caused by the storm.
meanings.sent2: He despaired of ever recovering from his illness.
meanings.sent3: The team despaired of winning the game after falling behind.
meanings.sent4: The villagers despaired as the drought continued, drying up their crops.
meanings.sent5: The prisoner despaired of ever being released, feeling trapped and hopeless.
